title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/05/2025 (Video)
OPEC+ Supply Hike Forces Wall Street to Redo Sums, Yet Again
content: A bold Saudi-led move to reorder the global oil market with an aggressive ramp-up of OPEC+ supply is forcing Wall Street observers to cut price forecasts, refine warnings for a glut and brace for more twists.

title: Audi Stuck With Low Returns on Rising Europe, China Competition
content: Volkswagen AG’s Audi continues to struggle with low returns as the German carmaker contends with tepid demand in Europe and intensifying competition in China.

title: Santander Sells 49% in Polish Unit to Erste for €6.8 Billion
content: Banco Santander SA agreed to sell 49% of its Polish unit to Erste Group Bank AG for about €6.8 billion ($7.7 billion), in one of the largest banking transactions in Europe in recent years.

title: Oil Sinks as OPEC+ Supply Surge Threatens to Swamp Global Market
content: Oil buckled on concerns of a global glut after OPEC+ agreed to another bumper output increase, adding to supply at a time when demand is challenged by the drag from the trade war.

title: Emerging Asia Currencies Rally, Spurred by Trade Deal Hopes
content: The currencies of Taiwan and Malaysia led advances among Asian peers on Monday, with sentiment lifted by hopes of a thaw in China-US trade tensions.

title: Swiss Inflation Drops to Zero as SNB Mulls More Rate Cuts
content: Swiss inflation slowed to the weakest in more than four years as the strong franc drives down the costs of imported goods.

title: Taiwan’s Markets Shaken as Currency Surges Most Since 1980s
content: Taiwan’s dollar surged as much as 5% on Monday, the biggest intraday gain in over three decades, on speculation exporters are rushing to convert their holdings of US dollars to the island’s currency.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/5/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Stock Futures Fall With Weak Dollar, Oil Drops: Markets Wrap
content: The dollar weakened and US equity-index futures dropped, threatening to end the S&P 500 Index’s longest winning streak in two decades, as US trade policy uncertainty hung over markets.

title: Taiwan Dollar Sees Generational Gain Against Greenback
content: Taiwan’s dollar surged on Monday, the biggest intraday gain in over three decades, on speculation exporters are rushing to convert their holdings of US dollars to the island’s currency. Bloomberg MLIV Strategist Mark Cranfield shares his insights. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China Resumes Spot LNG Purchases to Take Advantage of Price Drop
content: Chinese firms are purchasing liquefied natural gas shipments from the spot market, a reversal of months of relative inactivity from the world’s top buyer, after prices slumped to the lowest level in about a year.

title: Dollar’s Decline Is Fueling Dislocations Across Asian FX
content: Asian currencies ripped higher against the US dollar Monday, extending a move that’s hurting exporters, weighing on equities and forcing central banks to intervene in the market to curb excessive gains.

title: Dubai Ruler’s Investment Firm Plans to List Residential REIT
content: An investment conglomerate owned by Dubai’s ruler plans to list a portfolio of residential property assets on the local bourse, seeking to capitalize on the emirate’s real estate boom.

title: India Removes Top Envoy to IMF Who Criticized Fund’s Analysis
content: India recalled its top representative to the International Monetary Fund, a former adviser to Prime Minister Narendra Modi who publicly criticized the fund’s analysis.

title: Adani Camp Met US Officials in Push to End Bribery Cases
content: Bloomberg has learned that representatives for Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his companies met Trump administration officials about dismissing the criminal charges levied against him in an overseas bribery probe. Bloomberg's P R Sanjai shares what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/5/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says He’s Willing to Lower China Tariffs 'at Some Point'
content: US President Donald Trump says he is willing to lower tariffs on China "at some point" because the levies now are so high that the world’s two largest economies have essentially stopped doing business with each other. Bloomberg's Minmin Low has the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Asian Finance Chiefs Call for Regional Unity Amid Tariff Talks
content: Asian finance ministers and central bankers called for unity and reaffirmed their commitment to fair and free trade amid rising protectionism that they said weighs on the global economy.

title: How Trump's 100% Tariff on Overseas Films May Play Out
content: President Donald Trump says he plans to impose a 100% tariff on films produced overseas, extending his restrictive trade policies on US imports to the entertainment sector for the first time. Alpha CEO Steven Wolfe Pereira, a former Univision executive, suggests this will be difficult to implement as a way to boost "made in America" because most productions are global in nature, and foreign markets like China — the world's second-largest market for films — are key to a movie's success. He speaks on Bloomberg's The China Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Option Traders Bet on Aussie Outshining Kiwi as Trade Fears Ebb
content: Investors are buying currency options on the Australian dollar, wagering it will outperform its New Zealand counterpart as global trade tensions ease.

title: TechnologyOne CEO: We Need a 'Team Australia' Approach
content: The head of ASX-listed TechnologyOne, provider of software as a service (Saas), says the next Australian government needs to back of the nation's business community when the rest of the world "is not going to do us any favors." He adds that the government also has to face up to the twin crises of collapsing R&D investment and sliding productivity. TechnologyOne CEO and Managing Director Ed Chung speaks from Brisbane with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Shery Ahn on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 'More Weakness' to Come in US Economy: Morgan Stanley's Craig
content: Despite a bounce back in US equities as markets hope for light at the end of the tunnel in Trump's tariff war, there may still be "more weakness to come" in the US economy, according to Morgan Stanley's Kerry Craig. Speaking on Bloomberg TV, Craig adds that while he currently recommends global diversification, the US still has some "really good, high quality" companies that will continue to deliver. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Global Investors Drive Record Turnover for GIFT Nifty Derivatives
content: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: Hong Kong Dollar Tests Strong End of Trading Band for Second Day
content: The Hong Kong dollar tested the strong end of its allowable trading band for a second session Monday, as regional currencies rally amid broad weakness in the greenback.

title: Trump Suggests Some Trade Deals May Come as Soon as This Week
content: President Donald Trump suggested that his administration could strike trade deals with some countries as soon as this week, offering the prospect of relief for trading partners seeking to avoid higher US import duties.

title: Iron Ore Edges Up as Trump Signals Softer Stance on China Levies
content: Iron ore rose as sentiment across financial markets was boosted after US President Donald Trump said he was willing to lower tariffs on China at some point.

title: Gold Rises After Weekly Loss Before Fed Rate Decision This Week
content: Gold advanced — after its first back-to-back weekly loss this year — as investors mulled an uncertain outlook for global trade and the US economy ahead of a Federal Reserve rate decision this week.

title: Gold Fields Snaps Up Australian Rival in $2.4 Billion Deal
content: Gold Fields Ltd. will buy Gold Road Resources Ltd. in a deal valuing its Australian joint venture partner at A$3.7 billion ($2.4 billion), a sweetened offer following weeks of negotiations over their key project in Western Australia.

title: Taiwan Dollar Surges More Than 2% to Two-Year High vs US Dollar
content: Taiwan’s dollar extended a rally from the previous week, surging more than 2% in the first minutes of trading Monday.

title: Adani Camp Meets Trump Officials in Push to End US Bribery Cases
content: Representatives for Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his companies met Trump administration officials about dismissing the criminal charges levied against him in an overseas bribery probe, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Plans 100% Levy on Foreign Films, Deepening Trade War
content: President Donald Trump announced Sunday that he plans to impose a 100% tariff on films produced overseas, extending his restrictive trade policies on US imports to the entertainment sector for the first time.

title: Romania’s Far-Right Leader to Face Centrist Mayor in Runoff
content: A Romanian ultranationalist aligned with Donald Trump will head to a presidential runoff against the centrist mayor of Bucharest later this month after securing victory in a repeat election on Sunday, the latest blow to the nation’s ruling establishment.

title: India Removes Top Envoy to IMF Who Criticized Fund’s Analysis

content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese shocked Australia by securing an historic win in Saturday’s election. Now the question is whether he’ll use that mandate to push through tough measures to overhaul the nation’s economy.

title: Trump Suggests Some Trade Deals May Come as Soon as This Week

title: Japan’s Kato Walks Back Talk of Treasuries Sale in Trade Talks
content: Japan’s Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said the country won’t use the sale of its US Treasury holdings in trade talks with Washington, clarifying his previous remarks that suggested they could be used as a negotiating tool.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.
